videos.title: 🔒 What is a Constant in Go? | GoLang Interview Shorts 🚀
videos.description:
📘 In this GoLang short, learn what a *constant* is and how it's used in Go programming. Perfect for:

✅ Interview Prep
✅ GoLang Beginners
✅ Developers revising core concepts

💡 Key Takeaways:
- Constants are immutable and evaluated at compile time
- Declared using the `const` keyword

👨‍💻 #GoLang #Programming #InterviewPrep #GoDeveloper #LearnGo #DevTips
videos.playlistName: Golang Interview Shorts 🔥 | 1 Go Qn a Day | Crack Interviews Fast

videos.title: 🧠 Syntax of Constants in Go | GoLang Interview Prep 📌
videos.description:
🧾 Understand the correct syntax to declare constants in GoLang:

```go
const identifier type = value
```

🎯 Ideal for:
- Technical Interviews
- Quick Revision
- Learning Go Syntax

📌 Stay sharp, stay ready!

#GoLang #Shorts #InterviewTips #GoSyntax #TechShorts #LearnToCode
videos.playlistName: Golang Interview Shorts 🔥 | 1 Go Qn a Day | Crack Interviews Fast

videos.title: 💡 Implicit Typing in Go Constants | Interview Ready 🎓
videos.description:
📌 Did you know Go allows implicit typing with constants?

Example:
```go
const Pi = 3.14159
fmt.Printf("%T", Pi) // float64
```

🧠 Save this tip for interviews and Go mastery!

🔥 #GoLang #ImplicitTyping #DevShorts #CodingTips #InterviewQuestions
videos.playlistName: Golang Interview Shorts 🔥 | 1 Go Qn a Day | Crack Interviews Fast

videos.title: 📦 Declare Multiple Constants in Go | GoLang Short Tip ✨
videos.description:
🤓 Group constants efficiently in Go using block declarations:

```go
const (
  A = 1
  B = 2
  C = 3
)
```

💡 Clean, readable, and interview-approved!

🎯 #GoLang #GoTips #MultipleConstants #CodingShorts #GoLangInterview
videos.playlistName: Golang Interview Shorts 🔥 | 1 Go Qn a Day | Crack Interviews Fast

videos.title: 📌 Untyped vs Typed Constants in Go | Must-Know Interview Concept 🎯
videos.description:
💡 Understand the difference between **untyped** and **typed** constants in GoLang — a crucial topic for interviews and day-to-day Go development!

🧠 Key Points:
- Untyped constants: Flexible, type inferred by usage
- Typed constants: Fixed type, require conversion when mismatched

✅ Use this concept to avoid type mismatch errors in Go programs!

📚 Perfect for:
- Interview Prep
- Go Beginners & Developers
- Concept Revision

#GoLang #UntypedVsTyped #GoConstants #InterviewTips #GoShorts #ProgrammingFundamentals
videos.playlistName: Golang Interview Shorts 🔥 | 1 Go Qn a Day | Crack Interviews Fast

videos.title: 📊 Types of Constants in Go | Interview Summary Chart 🎯
videos.description:
🧾 Let's summarize how constants can be declared in Go:

- Single: `const name = value`
- Typed: `const name type = value`
- Grouped: `const ( a = 1; b = 2 )`

📘 Great for last-minute interview revision!

#GoLang #GoConstants #SyntaxChart #DevCheatsheet #InterviewCracker
videos.playlistName: Golang Interview Shorts 🔥 | 1 Go Qn a Day | Crack Interviews Fast

videos.title: ⚔️ Constants vs Variables in Go | Key Differences 📚
videos.description:
🧠 Know the difference between constants and variables in Go:

| Aspect        | Constant       | Variable       |
|---------------|----------------|----------------|
| Mutability    | Immutable      | Mutable        |
| Declaration   | `const`        | `var`, `:=`    |
| Eval Time     | Compile-time   | Run-time       |

🎓 Ace that GoLang interview!

#GoLang #ProgrammingBasics #ConstVsVar #InterviewGuide #Shorts
